description.plain: Belly has worked behind countless hits, as both a producer and writer. He’s notably co-written The Weeknd’s smash hits “Often” and “Earned It”, as he is an affiliate of the Toronto based “XO” movement. His two most recent projects Another Day In Paradise and Up For Days boast features from the likes of Travi$ Scott and The Weeknd, along with production from Boi-1da, with a trap-infused yet reflective sound.

body.plain: Belly has worked behind countless hits, as both a producer and writer. He’s notably co-written The Weeknd’s smash hits “Often” and “Earned It”, as he is an affiliate of the Toronto based “XO” movement. His two most recent projects Another Day In Paradise and Up For Days boast features from the likes of Travi$ Scott and The Weeknd, along with production from Boi-1da, with a trap-infused yet reflective sound.

songs.full_title: Might Not by Belly (Ft. The Weeknd)
songs.title: Might Not

description.plain:
For “Might Not”, Belly recruits his close friend and XO ringleader The Weeknd to drop a verse and sing the hook. The song is a blend of the two XO musicians' styles, and describes a night full of drugs and girls that might just go too far for the both of them.

The song became Belly’s first charting song, ultimately peaking at #68 on the all-genre Hot 100. However, the song did reach #1 on the Rhythmic Songs chart.

songs.embed_content: Read “Might Not” by Belly on Genius
